citeinfo.title: Master Routes with Official State Mileage Measures - Linear Referencing System

pubinfo.publish: GIS | BEST | ITD | Virginia Department of Transportation

descript.abstract:
This feature class consists of approximately 194,000 features representing around 70,000 miles of Interstate, Primary, Secondary and Urban roads throughout the State of Virginia. The Linear Referencing System is based on the Virginia Department of Transportation's Source System of Record for road inventory, Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS).
Geometry and Attribution: The Linear Referencing System (LRS) data contained within this feature class provides dissolved route segmentation (i.e. routes are not segmented when they intersect other routes), thus rendering one table record per route. Multi-part geometry is created where routes are noncontiguous (e.g. a valid physical gap exists because another route is the master). The feature class only depicts master routes, those are routes built in the prime direction and on divided roadways where the non-prime direction is the master. Each road centerline record has a master route record assigned.
Measures: The linear reference is based on Official State Mileage (OSM) as derived from reference points at Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS) roadway intersections (i.e. nodes/junctions). Note: The overlap and non-prime measures are for reference only and have not been fully validated for accuracy or completeness.
descript.purpose: This linear referenced data layer represents roadways that are maintained by the Virginia Department of Transportation and provides the underlying spatially enabled geometric network to which all "events" (e.g. potholes, pavement type, vehicle accidents, traffic counts, culverts, etc...) can be located.
descript.supplinf: Version Release Documentation: Contained within all Linear Referencing System data release packages are comprehensive release notes (e.g. “LRSx.x Release Notes.pdf”, where the x.x corresponds to the release version). These notes outline pertinent information concerning the release and provide general reference about the LRS. To determine which Linear Referencing layer will best suit your needs, see the appendix portion of the release notes for a Feature Class Application Matrix.

idinfo.useconst:
Disclaimer: The Virginia Department of Transportation's digital data files are for use in performing the official business of the Commonwealth of Virginia. Once the data are distributed outside of the agency, the Virginia Department of Transportation assumes no responsibility to maintain the data or metadata for the recipient in any manner or form. The data and metadata are provided "as is" and in no event shall the Commonwealth of Virginia, or its agencies or representatives, be liable for any damages, including but not limited to: damages resulting from lost data, lost profits or revenue, the costs of recovering such data, the costs of substitute data, claims by third parties, other similar costs, or any special, incidental, punitive, or consequential damages arising out of the use of the data.
Users of this data must credit the source(s). Use of these copyrightable files or data layers indicates agreements to abide by all copyright laws and restrictions regarding the files. The copyrightable files and hard-copy maps developed from the files may not be duplicated, sold or distributed without written permission from the Virginia Department of Transportation.
The representations of Virginia Department of Transportation business data contained within are believed to be correct. This data is provided without any guarantee of accuracy, timeliness or completeness. No business decisions should be made based on this data without validating its accuracy against the official source system of record. Users of this data are solely responsible for determining if it is appropriate for their application.
Virginia Department of Transportation Divisions set all policy on the allowable uses of this data.
Please report errors and omissions directly to the appropriate Virginia Department of Transportation Division data owner.

cntorgp.cntorg: GIS | BEST | ITD | Virginia Department of Transportation
cntorgp.cntper: GIS | BEST | ITD | Virginia Department of Transportation

idinfo.datacred:
This data was created as part of a joint effort between the Geographic Information System Program Office and the Roadway Network System Program, both contained under the Information Technology Division of the Virginia Department of Transportation. It also includes street names from the Virginia Geographic Information Network Master Centerlines.
© Copyright 2021 Virginia Department of Transportation - All Rights Reserved

attracc.attraccr:
Business attribute components for all Virginia Department of Transportation maintained routes are derived and maintained within Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS). The attributes in Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS) are field checked when a route is first created by the Maintenance Division or when modifications to existing routes are identified.
The Roadway Network System continually reviews business processes and works with the business units to ensure the proper attribution is maintained as changes occur. Mechanisms developed for the business unit allows them to identify attribute incontinences if they should occur.

dataqual.logic: The Linear Referencing System build process analyzes constructed routes determining if they are topologically continuous. Internal business rules dictate all necessary deviation from the aforementioned determination.
dataqual.complete:
The Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS) is the source system of record for this layer. The Roadway Network System (RNS) will replace Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS) and become the source system of record for this layer. The Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS) source data is split into two components, a business attribute component and a location component.
Business Component: The business attribute component contains all records in the Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS).
Location Component: There is currently a lag between the time a roadway is physically constructed and when it is entered into Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS) and then ultimately depicted the Geographic Information System Centerline. Computer-Aided Design files and local data are used where necessary. Ortho-rectified imagery is used in the creation and update process to ensure alignment. The Roadway Network System models Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS) and contains all location information, additional non-prime centerlines for divided primary and secondary routes and urban and street named networks. Currently the Roadway Network System contains most Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS) routes with a high degree of completeness for each route (95%+). Comparisons between the Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS) and the Roadway Network System networks will attempt to address all inconsistencies before the Roadway Network System becomes the source system of record. The Roadway Network System is based on creating a measured anchor section for each segment of the route. Detailed comparisons were done in the automated data conversion processes between the Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS) Link and Node based system and the Roadway Network System Anchor Section and Anchor Point based system to ensure completeness. Manual steps are being developed to handle special cases such as loop and loop back routes that were not possible to automate.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal accuracy for this layer can be defined as the probable error as measured along the linearly referenced route between reference calibration points. Such errors are largely dependent upon the degree of polyline resolution and the spatial alignment of the roadway with the actual centerline. Known reference point locations with known Official State Mileage values are used to ensure calibration of routes.

qhorizpa.horizpae: Precision of the mile points in the Roadway Inventory Management System (RIMS) is 53 feet (+/- 0.01 miles). Conversely location information may not have been recorded in the source system of record accurately such that errors of >0.1 miles can exist.

citeinfo.origin: GIS | BEST | ITD | Virginia Department of Transportation
citeinfo.title: GISE.GIS_DATA.ROAD

pubinfo.publish: GIS | BEST | ITD | Virginia Department of Transportation

srcinfo.srccontr:
This feature class provides geometric shapes and basic route attribution for all roadway centerlines.
This layer is updated continuously, therefore any rebuild of the linearly referenced features will utilize the latest available data.

citeinfo.origin: GIS | BEST | ITD | Virginia Department of Transportation
citeinfo.title: GISE.GIS_DATA. INTERSECTIONS

pubinfo.publish: GIS | BEST | ITD | Virginia Department of Transportation

srcinfo.srccontr: The route intersections provide known calibration points for the roadway segments from which the linearly referenced route can be built.

procstep.procdesc: Overview of geoprocessing Route Change Management: I. Get the GISE Road source feature class with the latest edits II. Get the road edges for the changed routes a. After this process is run - Then need to run calc_console.exe to set the 0-1 measures III. Delete then append edges by edge-rte-key to OSM and MPST change feature layers IV. Create and calibrate Interstate routes with the Mile Post measure points for changed routes a. After this process run SQL to update these measures back to the edge features V. Build edge-rte-key mile post measured features for changed routes VI. Build the OSM - Official State Measure - VDOT's official route measure (OSM) and mile post measure (MPST) changed route features VII. Append spatial data view based changed routes to full set for OSM and MPST layers VIII. Append spatial data view based change edge-rte-key to full set for OSM and MPST layers

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdefs: SIG | ITD | Virginia Department of Transportation

codesetd.codesetn: Linear Referencing Methods and Behaviors: Appendix A

attrdomv.udom: The RNS-defined unique name for the route. This name is a unique key used to identify a single route. It is guaranteed not to change over the life of the route for as long as that route exists.

attr.attrdefs: SIG | ITD | Virginia Department of Transportation

attrdomv.udom: The number assigned to the route for route signage. Definitionally, street name based routes will have a null value.

attr.attrdef: Used internally as an optional, additional information description of the route.
attr.attrdefs: SIG | ITD | Virginia Department of Transportation

cntorgp.cntper: GIS | BEST | ITD | Virginia Department of Transportation

distinfo.distliab: The information depicted in this GIS layer is the result of digital analyses performed on a database consisting of information from a variety of governmental and other credible sources. The accuracy of the information presented is limited to the collective accuracy of the database on the date of the analysis. The information is believed accurate and reasonable efforts have been made to ensure the accuracy of the data. However, the Spatial Intelligence Group, Virginia Department of Transportation expressly disclaims responsibility for damages or liability that may arise from use of this data.

digtinfo.formname: ESRI data format, dependent upon request

onlinopt.accinstr: Contact COITDSIG@VDOT.Virginia.Gov for access to FTP site.
Must have access to VDOT internal network.

stdorder.ordering: This data set is available to VDOT users in electronic format as a geodatabase or shapefile via ftp, e-mail attachment or on CD-ROM

distinfo.techpreq: Must have software capable of processing Zip files and ESRI geodatabses or shapefiles for the download data. Must have software able to read an ESRI map service if using the map service.
